apiClassifier.shortdesc: An integer indicating the type of error generated.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: An integer indicating the type of error generated.

apiValue.shortdesc: If an attempt was made to load a document, or an XML Fragment, using LSParser and the processing has been stopped.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If an attempt was made to load a document, or an XML Fragment, using LSParser and the processing has been stopped.

apiValue.shortdesc: If an attempt was made to serialize a Node using LSSerializer and the processing has been stopped.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If an attempt was made to serialize a Node using LSSerializer and the processing has been stopped.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The DocumentLS interface provides a mechanism by which the content of a document can be replaced with the DOM tree produced when loading a URI, or parsing a string.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The DocumentLS interface provides a mechanism by which the content of a document can be replaced with the DOM tree produced when loading a URI, or parsing a string. The expectation is that an instance of the DocumentLS interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Document interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If the document is currently being loaded as a result of the method load being invoked the loading and parsing is immediately aborted.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If the document is currently being loaded as a result of the method load being invoked the loading and parsing is immediately aborted. The possibly partial result of parsing the document is discarded and the document is cleared.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replaces the content of the document with the result of parsing the given URI.

apiReturn.apiDesc: If async is set to true load returns true if the document load was successfully initiated. If an error occurred when initiating the document load load returns false. If async is set to false load returns true if the document was successfully loaded and parsed. If an error occurred when either loading or parsing the URI load returns false.

apiParam.apiDesc: The URI reference for the XML file to be loaded. If this is a relative URI, the base URI used by the implementation is implementation dependent.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Replaces the content of the document with the result of parsing the given URI. Invoking this method will either block the caller or return to the caller immediately depending on the value of the async attribute. Once the document is fully loaded the document will fire a "load" event that the caller can register as a listener for. If an error occurs the document will fire an "error" event so that the caller knows that the load failed (see ParseErrorEvent). If this method is called on a document that is currently loading, the current load is interrupted and the new URI load is initiated.
Note (Mozilla): As of at least Gecko 1.9, this no longer supports cross-site loading of documents (Use XMLHttpRequest instead).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replace the content of the document with the result of parsing the input string, this method is always synchronous.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if parsing the input string succeeded without errors, otherwise false.

apiParam.apiDesc: A string containing an XML document.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Replace the content of the document with the result of parsing the input string, this method is always synchronous. This method always parses from a DOMString, which means the data is always UTF16. All other encoding information is ignored.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Save the document or the given node to a string (i.e.

apiException.apiDesc: WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: Raised if the node passed in as the node parameter is from an other document.

apiParam.apiDesc: Specifies what to serialize, if this parameter is null the whole document is serialized, if it's non-null the given node is serialized.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Save the document or the given node to a string (i.e. serialize the document or node).

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates whether the method load should be synchronous or asynchronous.

apiException.apiDesc: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the implementation doesn't support the mode the attribute is being set to.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Indicates whether the method load should be synchronous or asynchronous. When the async attribute is set to true the load method returns control to the caller before the document has completed loading.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: DOMImplementationLS contains the factory methods for creating Load and Save objects.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
DOMImplementationLS contains the factory methods for creating Load and Save objects.
The expectation is that an instance of the DOMImplementationLS interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the DOMImplementation interface or, if the Document supports the feature "Core" version "3.0" defined in DOM Level 3 Core, by using the method DOMImplementation.getFeature with parameter values "LS" (or "LS-Async") and "3.0" (respectively).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a new empty input source object where LSInput.characterStream, LSInput.byteStream, LSInput.stringData LSInput.systemId, LSInput.publicId, LSInput.baseURI, and LSInput.encoding are null, and LSInput.certifiedText is false.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a new empty input source object where LSInput.characterStream, LSInput.byteStream, LSInput.stringData LSInput.systemId, LSInput.publicId, LSInput.baseURI, and LSInput.encoding are null, and LSInput.certifiedText is false.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a new empty output destination object where LSOutput.characterStream, LSOutput.byteStream, LSOutput.systemId, LSOutput.encoding are null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a new empty output destination object where LSOutput.characterStream, LSOutput.byteStream, LSOutput.systemId, LSOutput.encoding are null.

apiException.apiDesc: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the requested mode or schema type is not supported.

apiReturn.apiDesc:
The newly created LSParser object. This LSParser is either synchronous or asynchronous depending on the value of the mode argument.
Note: By default, the newly created LSParser does not contain a DOMErrorHandler, i.e. the value of the "error-handler" configuration parameter is null. However, implementations may provide a default error handler at creation time. In that case, the initial value of the "error-handler" configuration parameter on the new LSParser object contains a reference to the default error handler.

apiParam.apiDesc: The mode argument is either MODE_SYNCHRONOUS or MODE_ASYNCHRONOUS, if mode is MODE_SYNCHRONOUS then the LSParser that is created will operate in synchronous mode, if it's MODE_ASYNCHRONOUS then the LSParser that is created will operate in asynchronous mode.

An absolute URI representing the type of the schema language used during the load of a Document using the newly created LSParser. Note that no lexical checking is done on the absolute URI. In order to create a LSParser for any kind of schema types (i.e. the LSParser will be free to use any schema found), use the value null.
Note: For W3C XML Schema [XML Schema Part 1], applications must use the value "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema". For XML DTD [XML 1.0], applications must use the value "http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml". Other Schema languages are outside the scope of the W3C and therefore should recommend an absolute URI in order to use this method.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a new LSParser. The newly constructed parser may then be configured by means of its DOMConfiguration object, and used to parse documents by means of its parse method.

apiReturn.apiDesc:
The newly created LSSerializer object.
Note: By default, the newly created LSSerializer has no DOMErrorHandler, i.e. the value of the "error-handler" configuration parameter is null. However, implementations may provide a default error handler at creation time. In that case, the initial value of the "error-handler" configuration parameter on the new LSSerializer object contains a reference to the default error handler.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: An interface to an object that is able to build, or augment, a DOM tree from various input sources.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: An interface to an object that is able to build, or augment, a DOM tree from various input sources.

apiValue.shortdesc: Append the result of the parse operation as children of the context node.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Append the result of the parse operation as children of the context node. For this action to work, the context node must be an Element or a DocumentFragment.

apiValue.shortdesc: Insert the result of the parse operation as the immediately following sibling of the context node.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Insert the result of the parse operation as the immediately following sibling of the context node. For this action to work the context node's parent must be an Element or a DocumentFragment.

apiValue.shortdesc: Insert the result of the parse operation as the immediately preceding sibling of the context node.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Insert the result of the parse operation as the immediately preceding sibling of the context node. For this action to work the context node's parent must be an Element or a DocumentFragment.

apiValue.shortdesc: Replace the context node with the result of the parse operation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Replace the context node with the result of the parse operation. For this action to work, the context node must have a parent, and the parent must be an Element or a DocumentFragment.

apiValue.shortdesc: Replace all the children of the context node with the result of the parse operation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Replace all the children of the context node with the result of the parse operation. For this action to work, the context node must be an Element, a Document, or a DocumentFragment.

apiValue.shortdesc: Interrupt the normal processing of the document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Interrupt the normal processing of the document.

apiValue.shortdesc: Reject the node and its children.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Reject the node and its children.
Skip this single node. The children of this node will still be considered.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface represents a progress event object that notifies the application about progress as a document is parsed.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface represents a progress event object that notifies the application about progress as a document is parsed.
